intro: Humboltia ephemera, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the nightshade family and is characterized by its short lifespan, blooming and dying within a few weeks. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its brief blooming period, it is considered a rare and elusive species.
